intro: Nortenia thouarsii var. nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered nortenia, is a unique variant of the nortenia plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking white flowers, which contrast with its green foliage, making it a visually appealing species. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is known for its ornamental value. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
